alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 11:41AM PST until February 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. * WHERE...Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 1 AM PST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow will be at 250 feet and higher in elevation. Snow amounts will be spotty and may see periods of breaks in snowfall.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
